result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adina R Whitecloud

defendant.name: Whitecloud, Adina R
defendant.address: 711 N Park Ave Apt 1, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt: Requesting court appointed paperwork to be sent over to the jail. Clerk sent.

Requesting bond monies back she posted on cases- 19CF131, 21Cf30 and 22Cf143
10/19- Letter requesting money she posted on 21CF30
10/19 Letter requesting money she posted on 21CF30

11:08 AM Defendant Adina R Whitecloud appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Request for bail bond hearing, court reviewed file, four letters in the file from the defendant. Court address the letters in the case regarding bond that she posted bond for other defendants and is now asking for that money be returned to her, court explains that process, will set bond hearings in those cases. Clerk advises letters are in the respective cases and have been sent to the JA for scheduling. Also requesting bond be modified in this case. Whitecloud makes bond argument, has been in contact with Gary Cirilli for pleas in other cases, would like to go to drug court. Court reviews complaint and questions if she is going to hire an attorney. Whitecloud indicates she has discussion with Attorney Cirilli. State indicates other cases were set for PLEAS, she backed out of the plea offer and it is now rejected, drug court was not part of the plea offer as she is not eligible for drug court. Court questions her income. Whitecloud does not have any money, relies on family. Court advises of representation for SPD, court appointed or private hire. Whitecloud has contacted SPD, she qualifies but they do not have an attorney at this time. Court instructs her to continue to contact SPD. State asks for bond to remain for reasons as stated on the record. Court questions open cases. State - currently has 10 open cases. Whitecloud tries to make statement about some of the cases. Court interrupts her and instructs not to say anything regarding details of the cases. Court will continue bond as currently set and encourages her to continue to contact SPD. Whitecloud questions the bond requests for other defendant's that she posted for and asks the court to clarify the process. Court responds.
Requesting bond reduction/ bail money back.- she posted
Requesting money posted on case 21Cf30 and 22CF143
Bail/bond hearing on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No contact with Travis Bird, Megan Mihalko or Aaron Morris except for purposes of removing items from living situation.

9:36 AM Defendant Adina R Whitecloud appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Whitecloud indicates she has been writing letters and asks if she can read the letters to the court. Court will not allow her to read the letters to the court at this time but may address bond after reading the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has not. Has had Cirilli in other cases, but has a balance due with him and has to pay prior to retaining him, should be accomplished within the next two weeks. Whitecloud asks for bond reduction, high signature bond. State corrects Whitecloud there is no offer - has been revoked on other cases and asks for bond to increase to $25,000 cash in this case. Court continues bond with the addition of condition of no contact with Travis Bird, Megan Mihalko or Aaron Morris except for purposes of removing items from living situation. Whitecloud asks if she can continue to request bond reductions. Court responds.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.
